result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Rachel M Pleet

defendant.name: Pleet, Rachel M
defendant.address: N16070 Cty Rd G, Nekoosa, WI 54457

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Stipulation and Order for Jail Credit /s/ TTF 06/27/14

Defendant Rachel M Pleet in court with attorney Eric Sheets. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Cases heard at this time are 13CF-156, 13CM-170, 14CF-14 and 13CF-284.

2:34 PM Court calls cases and states appearances.
These matters have been resolved, originally they were set for trial.

Atty Knaapen addresses the Court.
13CF-156: amending charge to two counts 947.1mb 943.50(4)(a), Class A Misdemeanors Defendant will plead to the two amended counts
60 day jail sentence, each count consecutive, imposed/stayed, probation 24 mo, aoda if not done so otherwise comply with treatment recomm, no drug provisions, take mediation only as prescribed, all prescriptions from 1 pharm, sign necessary releases of information, obt/mtn ft empt, other counseling, no contact with walmart store, pay court costs
13CM-170: Defendant will plead to count as charged. 60 day jail consecutive to 13CF-156, imposed/stayed, prob 24 mo, same conditions, not be in Shopko in Plover
13CF-284: will waive right to prelim, Defendant will plead to Count 1 and Count 2. Count 3-4 dismiss and read in, withheld sentence, prob 24 mo, same conditions as other cases, no contact or be on premises of Shopko store in St Pt, pay costs
14CF-14: waive right to prelim, State would move to dismiss and read in all 4 counts.

Parties are comfortable to do plea and sentencing if the Court is, this is a joint recommendation, can go forward without a PSI.

Atty Sheets concurs.

Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
13CF-284 and 14CF-14, preliminary waivers have been filed.

13CF-284 and 14CF-14 are addressed first.
Court informs Defendant of charges and penalties.
Defendant waives right to preliminary hearings on both
Atty Sheets has received copies of complaints, waives reading. 
Atty Sheets has gone over both criminal complaints with his client.
Defendant concurs.
Court informs Defendant of right to preliminary examination.
Defendant has signed the documents.
Court questions Atty Sheets regarding waiver.

BY THE COURT:
Court finds the Defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived the Preliminary Hearing.

State files information.
Atty Sheets received a copy of the informations.

Atty Sheets enters NOT GUILTY pleas on all counts in 14CF-14
State will file an amended information  for 13CF-156.

Defendant enters a plea of: NO CONTEST 13CF-156 Count 1 and Count 2
Defendant enters a plea of: NO CONTEST 13CM-170
Defendant enters a plea of: NO CONTEST 13CF-284 Count 1 and Count 2

Court questions Defendant regarding pleas.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney Sheets for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Both attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charges.
There has been victim notification.

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charges.
Court finds the defendant guilty.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.
13CF-156: Count 1 Retail Theft
13CF-156: Count 2 Retail Theft
13CM-170: Retail Theft
13CF-284: Count 1 
13CF-284: Count 2
13CF-284 Count 3 and Count 4 are dismissed and read in
14CF-14: Dismissed and read in.

Both parties are prepared to go to sentencing today.

Atty Knaapen addresses the Court prior to sentencing, there is cash bond pending on two of the files, may be applied against all/any court costs. There was no restitution requested.
Atty Sheets addresses the Court prior to sentencing, this is a joint recommendation. 
Defendant addresses the Court prior to sentencing.

Court has a number of factors to consider to determine sentencing. 
Court has decided not to order a PSI.

BY THE COURT:
13CF-156:
Count 1:
Amended
Jail sentence of 60 days, IMPOSED/STAYED
Huber granted if approved by jail administration
Probation for a period of 24 Months
Comply with all aftercare treatment recommendations from AODA Assessment. Be in full compliance
Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription
Fill all prescriptions from one pharmacy
Sign necessary releases of information for agent, to monitor, prescriptions and physicians
Obtain and maintain full time employment or schooling or a combination of both to equal full time
Comply with other counseling as recommended by the agent
No contact with Walmart store in Plover, WI
Pay court costs
Court will not order the DNA surcharge
Count 2:
Amended
Jail sentence of 60 days, consecutive to Count 1, IMPOSED/STAYED
Huber granted if approved by jail administration
Probation for a period of 24 Months, concurrent to Count 1
Comply with conditions of probation as stated in Count 1
Pay court costs
Court will not order the DNA surcharge

13CM-170: 
Jail sentence of 60 days, consecutive to 13CF-156, IMPOSED/STAYED
Huber granted if approved by jail administration
Probation for a period of 24 Months, concurrent to 13CF-156
Comply with conditions of probation as stated in 13CF-156 
Pay court costs 
Court will not order the DNA surcharge
Not contact with Shopko store in Plover, WI

13CF-284:
Count 1:
Sentence is Withheld
Probation for a period of 24 Months, concurrent to 13CF-156 and 13CM-170
Comply with conditions of probation as stated on 13CF-156 and 13CM-170
Pay court costs
No contact with Shopko store in Stevens Point, WI
Submit DNA sample and pay the surcharge
Count 2:
Sentence is Withheld
Probation for a period of 24 Months, concurrent to Count 1, 13CF-156 and 13CM-170
Comply with conditions of probation as stated in Count 1, 13CF-156 and 13CM-170
Pay court costs

Any bonds posted in any files shall be applied to the court costs ordered.

Atty Knaapen addresses the Court with regards to surcharges compared to the DNA sample being ordered. 
Atty Sheets replies.
Court questions Atty Knaapen for clarifications.

Voting rights are addressed.
Pretrial incarceration credit is addressed.
Parties will look at the credit and get back to the Court.

BY THE COURT:
Any warrants are quashed.
